text: back in the days when it went by the name desert passage i had a stronger affinity for this place since it housed unconventional stores unlike the runofthemill shops commonly found in malls consequently my expectations fall short when i think of the legendary miracle mile which instantly transports me to the lively streets of chicago filled with highend shopping opportunities
its unfortunate how the food which holds promise is gradually losing its appeal
the store with four levels is enjoyable but the prices are excessively high
original phrase fun four story store but very overpriced

memories of my youthful adventures at thrift stores flood my mind upon entering this establishmentâ€”distinctly different from overpriced counterparts like goodwill though everything is impeccably organized the feeling of excitement that comes with searching for unique items remains intact thanks to their exemplary customer service additionally within steps of the entrance youll find easily accessible donation stations promoting a sense of community engagement
have you ever considered the fact that sexual orientation is not safeguarded in stein marts employee handbook it is crucial to boycott any establishment that fails to endorse equal rights

when i step into this store it brings back memories of thrift stores from my childhood not like the costly ones such as goodwill everything is organized but the excitement of exploring for hidden treasures still lingers and their exceptional customer service is paired with conveniently located donation areas just inside the entrance

i am reminded of my younger years and the thrift stores i used to visit when i step foot in this establishment unlike the overpriced options like goodwill everything is wellorganized here but the sense of adventure in searching for hidden gems remains the staff provides excellent customer service and you can conveniently drop off donations just inside the front door
would you say this is a great place to get a filling breakfast that isnt overly corporate the meals are generously portioned and reasonably priced but the menu could benefit from more options

take note of the expiration dates i have personally observed expired cheese and eggs being kept on the shelves the stores inventory management and restocking procedures appear to be inadequate but the staff at starbucks exhibit great service nevertheless exercise caution when buying produce and refrigerated goods

this shop evokes nostalgic feelings of the thrift stores i frequented during my childhood unlike the expensive options like goodwill the items neatly arranged in here capture the essence of those days when the thrill of finding something special was everpresent while the friendly staff ensures a great shopping experience with donation dropoffs conveniently placed near the front door

compared to terminal 1 and the antiquated terminal 2 terminal 3 stands out as a topnotch option thanks to its outstanding assortment of dining establishments and bars as well as its spacious dutyfree area that caters perfectly to lastminute shopping needs

i absolutely adore the food particularly the lamb kabob and chapli kabob the staff was incredibly friendly and the place was immaculate all the dishes were made with fresh ingredients and the portion sizes were very generous i will definitely be visiting this place again

the indoor lions enclosure is incredibly fascinating recently i saw a lion from below the glass ceiling as it rested and it was my first time seeing its rear end standing there and observing this sight was such a unique and amazing experience you definitely shouldnt miss it
although the fourstory store is entertaining it is highly expensive
its regrettable to witness the gradual descent of the food that had such great potential

our birthday dinner experience was fantastic  we received a warm welcome and were seated at a lovely window seat all the staff were friendly and provided excellent service i highly recommend the surf and turf dish which was definitely worth the price and lets not forget about the incredibly delicious clam chowder arguably the best outside of the east coast

this establishment serves incredibly delicious meals despite having walked past it countless times for over a year i finally gave it a chance and i was not disappointed the chicken teriyaki skewers and the rice bowl which combined both beef and chicken were particularly outstanding if youre in the strip i highly advise paying a visit to this place
thai food is my favorite and i love dining at this restaurant plus they have the added bonus of delivering food right to your doorstep

with its impressive range of dining options and an expansive dutyfree area the recently opened terminal 3 outshines terminal 1 and the outdated terminal 2 making it a highly preferred choice for travelers

it could be argued that this is the most outstanding performance i have ever experienced in las vegas it left me utterly speechless and unquestionably justified the cost remember to stay vigilant for ticket sales for tonights show because you wouldnt want to miss out the quality of this diverse spectacle is truly astounding and i am certain we will have the pleasure of enjoying it once more

after pulling over for gas i observed that the rebels i encountered in this area seemed less wellmaintained compared to those at the ampm store nearby and it was clear that the convenience store here offered fewer choices

the establishment provides a fantastic experience with chilled beer delightful music amiable employees and flavorsome yet uncomplicated dishes in my opinion you shouldnt miss out on their exceptional fish tacos

i recently had a burger that was lacking in taste to the point where i had to add salt and pepper to make it somewhat enjoyable the entree of the day was ribs but they were horrible  it felt like chewing on rubber with cold bbq sauce

perfect the good is actually quite tasty i had the california chicken burger with a side salad i like the way they stuff their griddles chicken breast with avocado and their side salad is made with fresh greens i would definitely recommend this place for lunch

this store brings back memories of my childhood visits to thrift stores unlike the highpriced ones like goodwill everything is neat and orderly but the excitement of the search for unique items still persists their customer service is topnotch and you can find convenient donation spots right at the entrance

at this establishment you can enjoy a wonderful combination of refreshing beer great music welcoming staff and tasty yet straightforward dishes while the menu may not be overly highend i highly recommend trying their exceptional fish tacos

the food here is very oily and it looks like need a big clean here some dishes taste ok but it still very oily the guy is very friendly but the lady she is so rude  for many times i came here because it is closer to my location but  the food is really unhealthy too much oil

is this establishment regarded as a top choice for a pleasant breakfast experience where you wont encounter generic flavors the portions are quite generous and the prices fair for what you receive in terms of both quality and quantity it may not exceed expectations but the menu is satisfactory albeit with room for improvement

i deeply regret to inform you that my recent visit to this establishment can only be characterized as profoundly unsatisfactory it pains me greatly to report that not a single high chair within the premises had functioning straps which led to numerous instances of my child slipping through the openings furthermore the quality of service provided was nothing short of dreadful with the waitress bringing part of our order incorrectly and subjecting us to an excessively long wait for the bill which ultimately never materialized based on this entirely disappointing experience i strongly discourage anyone from patronizing this establishment again

this mexican eatery never disappoints when it comes to delicious food options at reasonable prices  you can indulge in a mouthwatering rib eye steak accompanied by flavorful shrimp without draining your wallet and their commitment to maintaining a clean environment is truly impressive

my enthusiasm for this place is lacking primarily due to their choice of sweet pickles on the burgers and my dissatisfaction with their barbecue sauce in terms of value i find other burger joints more appealing compared to this relatively expensive option

was craving a burger and thought i could get it here the menu pics glorified their burgers too much as the final product looked like a standard fast food burger taste was decent but was looking for something of higher quality as they advertise themselves to be

would you consider this restaurant to be among the superior spots to enjoy a scrumptious breakfast free of a corporate ambiance the servings are notably ample and reasonably priced reflecting a commendable balance of quality and quantity though it may not boast exceptional greatness the menu suffices although an expansion could enhance its appeal

you can expect a fantastic experience at this bar featuring cold beer enjoyable music friendly staff and flavorful yet uncomplicated cuisine personally i had a great time trying their fish tacos which were absolutely delicious
if you are unable to derive satisfaction from your experience here it is safe to assume that you are incapable of having a positive time

during my trip to montreal i went with a friend and tried the sashimi which unfortunately lacked freshness in comparison to the allyoucaneat sushi places in toronto this one did not meet my expectations i would not give it a favorable rating and suggest avoiding it altogether
this place has amazing thai food that i absolutely adore the fact that they deliver makes it even better

the recently inaugurated terminal 3 provides an exceptional experience with its remarkable selection of restaurants and bars ample dutyfree offerings for impromptu shopping outperforming both terminal 1 and the outdated terminal 2

the food is good maybe like 35 stars sushi selection is pretty poor but the other food is pretty decent  bellagio is definitely better in terms of food and a million times better in terms of servicenni think we saw our waitress once the whole time we even had to clear our own tables
though the taste isnt too different its a noteworthy option in place of starbucks yet the guy with the peculiar ponytail not the owner can be irritating
had the az devil hot dog here was ok a bit small of a portion the fries were good will definately try the burgers next time friendly service

in comparison to its previous identity as the desert passage i have a preference for this place due to its distinct stores instead of generic malltype establishments however it fails to live up to the vibrant atmosphere i imagine when i hear the term miracle mile â€“ a renowned symbol of indulgent shopping experiences that aligns with the city of chicago

although the difference in taste isnt substantial it offers a commendable choice apart from starbucks nonetheless there is a somewhat vexing aspect related to the gentleman having an eccentric ponytail who should be distinguished from the owner
the inability to have a good time in this location suggests an absolute incapacity to experience any form of entertainment or satisfaction

possibly the most incredible show i have witnessed in las vegas it was absolutely mindblowing and definitely worth every penny tickets for tonights performance are on sale as well so make sure to keep an eye out this variety show is just amazing and i am sure we will be seeing it again

this was one of the most unpleasant establishments i have visited none of the high chairs had functional straps causing my son to continuously slip through the gaps the service was abysmal as the waitress made errors with our order and we endured an extremely long wait for the bill i would strongly advise against ever visiting this place again
although it was very loud and the food was moderately good it failed to meet the exaggerated expectations
the bar offers a pleasant atmosphere with refreshing beer enjoyable music friendly staff and delicious albeit simple food personally i highly recommend trying their fish tacos
the noise level was overwhelming although the food was decent it didnt justify all the hype

i had an exceptionally dull burger that had absolutely no flavor it was surprising for me because i usually never have to use salt and pepper on burgers however this specific burger required that additional seasoning the ribs which were highlighted as one of the entrees of the day were an unpleasant experience they tasted like rubber and were accompanied by cold bbq sauce making it even worse

i found this place more appealing when it was known as the desert passage because it had a variety of unique stores that set it apart from regular malltype establishments however the current selection of stores lacks the excitement and distinctiveness that i associate with the name miracle mile whenever i think of miracle mile i envision the vibrant shopping experience of chicagos renowned shopping district which is far from what this place offers
what a shame that the food with its potential is slowly declining in quality

looking for amazing food ive been passing by this place for over a year and finally decided to give it a try everything was outstanding especially the chicken teriyaki skewers and the rice bowl with beef and chicken this is definitely a mustvisit spot when youre on the strip

i have to thank brittney for her wonderful cupcakes  i own a local catering company her in vegas and she did some cupcakes nfor a client of mine they were so impressed by her yummy desserts  thanks brittney for a job well done

irenes remarkable amicability was evident as she willingly catered to my outrageous coffee concoction request crafting it with unparalleled deliciousness without a doubt this location surpasses the other branch in the area
the noise level was quite high but the quality of food was average and didnt live up to the excessive praise

in the past when this place went by the name desert passage i enjoyed it more due to its unconventional stores that deviated from the typical malltype offerings unfortunately the current stores here fail to meet my expectations when compared to the iconic miracle mile which instantly transports me to the bustling streets of chicago filled with upscale shopping opportunities its disheartening that this place falls short of delivering a similar highend shopping experience

i have a great fondness for the food particularly the lamb kabob and chapli kabob the staff at this place went above and beyond in terms of friendliness and the level of cleanliness was topnotch fresh ingredients were used in every dish and the quantity served was more than satisfying without a doubt i will make it a point to visit this place again
the inability to have a good time in this location implies a complete lack of ability to experience any form of amusement or gratification
was going to grimaldis the right choice that i missed out on

possibly the most incredible show ive witnessed in las vegas it was absolutely mindblowing and definitely worth every penny they are currently selling tickets for tonights performance so make sure to pay close attention this is an extraordinary variety show that exceeded all expectations and i am confident that we will attend it again

the burger i had was extremely tasteless unlike any other burger ive ever eaten typically i dont need to add salt and pepper but for this particular burger i had to the ribs were one of the daily specials but they turned out to be terrible it felt like eating rubber smothered in cold bbq sauce

i was not impressed with the american kobe burger i had it was cooked unevenly and quite dry it had an abundance of lettuce tomato onion but only one pickle in my opinion it was not worth the price of 17
its always a reliable choice for mexican cuisine what i love is that i can order a rib eye steak with shrimp without breaking my budget and the cleanliness of this place is exceptional

i will only come here if the band playing is someone i reaaaaallly wanna see its way to hot in there not too impressed with staffbar or door and any place that has drive buys when hip hop shows are bookednot a huge fan

my experience with the american kobe burger was disappointing the cooking was uneven leaving it dry and lacking flavor despite having a generous serving of lettuce tomato and onion it only came with one thin pickle given all these factors i found it overpriced at 17
did you know that stein marts employee handbook does not include protection for sexual orientation it is crucial not to support a store that lacks support for equal rights
this is the only place open near work at 3am the service was good but had to wait for hot coffee which was a bit annoying
